title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1 MIDCH: QUALITY HEALTHCARE, NUTRITION, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: 2.1 By 2022, the Health and Nutrition service delivery systems provide quality healthcare, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and nutrition interventions for girls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived, benefit from healthy, nurturing, protective environments and live free from violence.

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF NATIONAL COMMUNITY WATER SUPPLY
NATIONAL WATER SUPPLY AND DRAINAGE BOARD
STATE MINISTRY OF RURAL AND DIVISIO DRINKING WATER SUPPLY PROJECT DEVELOPMENT

Strengthening data and national information systems, including routine systems, nutrition surveys and assessments (early childhood nutrition)
Water Supply in communities –service delivery – rural
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.1 By 2022, the Health and Nutrition service delivery systems provide quality healthcare, WASH and nutrition interventions forgirls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived

description.narrative: The School Health Policy is awaiting to be submitted for cabinet approval shortly.The household water quality assessment to generate data for SDG 6.2 on safely managed drinking water at the household level was conducted. The National Survey of the Community Managed Rural Water Supply Schemes supported identifying key indicators and updated them in the information management and monitoring system of the National Department of Community Water Supply (http://rwss.lk/wp/rwss_statistics/). | Status:Met | As-of Date:02/02/2022

title.narrative: Availability of baseline information on safely managed water supply (SDG indicator 6.1) at household level(66675), Text

baseline.value: Score 1: No baseline data available on safely managed water supply at household level (SDG indicator 6.1)

target.value: 2022:Score 3 (The national protocols for the management of SAM based on WHO standards (2013) have been drafted.)

actual.value: 2021:Score 2 The training of 36 field teams, including enumerators and water quality testers, and field data collection of the household water quality assessment were completed by the Department of Census and Statistics. Data for the SDG 6.1 at the household

title.narrative: Availability of tested models on climate-resilient water supply systems that promote water safety and security(66674), Text

target.value: 2022:Score 5 (The national protocols for the management of SAM based on WHO standards (2013) have been finalized and endorsed by the government.)

actual.value: 2021:Score 3- The pilot models of climate resilient water safety plans were developed responding to the recommendations of the water safety plan study report. The implementation is planned jointly with the Water Safety Plan advisory committee in 2022.

title.narrative: Availability of a school health and nutrition policy(66673), Text

actual.value: 2021:Final draft of the School Health Policy was submitted to and endorsed by the Secretary of the Ministry of Education. Preparations underway to submit to the Cabinet for final endorsement.
